title: U.S. Attacked Boat With Aircraft That Looked Like a Civilian Plane
summary: Even accepting the Trump administration’s claim that there is an armed conflict with suspected drug runners, the laws of war bar “perfidy.”

title: Trump’s Plans for Venezuelan Oil Run Headlong Into Reality
summary: President Trump’s fixation on Venezuela’s oil raises the question of how much “energy dominance” is really worth nowadays.

title: Lawyer Whom Maduro Didn’t Hire Is Booted From His Case
summary: Last week, a lawyer came forward claiming to represent the unseated president of Venezuela, Nicolás Maduro. The judge overseeing the case settled the matter on Monday.

title: FBI’s ICE Shooting Inquiry Examines Renee Good’s Possible Ties to Activist Groups
summary: Former department officials warned that such a broad inquiry raised the specter that forms of political protests could be criminalized.

title: Trump Suggests Renee Good’s ‘Disrespectful’ Attitude Justified Fatal ICE Shooting
summary: President Trump suggested that Renee Good’s “highly disrespectful” attitude toward law enforcement played a role in her fatal shooting by an ICE agent.

title: Fed Changes Course and Takes On Trump’s Political Fight
summary: The Justice Department’s decision to open up a criminal investigation of Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, is a major escalation in the pressure campaign against the central bank to cut interest rates.

title: A Top Fed Official Conveys Little Urgency for Immediate Rate Cuts
summary: The Federal Reserve is likely to hold interest rates steady when it meets at the end of the month, keeping tensions high with President Trump.

title: Labor Secretary’s Aides Placed on Leave in Misconduct Investigation
summary: The Labor Department is investigating a complaint alleging misconduct by Secretary Lori Chavez-DeRemer.

title: Kelly Sues Pentagon Over Threats of Punishment From Hegseth
summary: Senator Mark Kelly, Democrat of Arizona, asked a federal judge to block the Trump administration from disciplining him for a video warning about illegal military orders.

title: Judge Blocks Trump Effort to Stop Rhode Island’s Revolution Wind Project
summary: The ruling means that construction can continue on Revolution Wind, a $6.2 billion project off the coast of Rhode Island, at least for now.

title: Trump Cuts to Energy Projects in Blue States Were Unlawful, Judge Rules
summary: The Energy Department canceled $7.5 billion in Biden-era energy spending, largely in Democratic-led states, during last year’s government shutdown.

title: Photos: Backstage With Teyana Taylor, Owen Cooper and More Golden Globe Winners
summary: Rose Byrne, Owen Cooper, Seth Rogen, Teyana Taylor and other award winners in the spotlight.

title: Nikki Glaser’s Monologue, Teyana Taylor’s Speech and Other Moments From the 2026 Globes
summary: Nikki Glaser returned as host and killed, while Teyana Taylor delivered the speech of the night. Then there were those awful production choices.

title: Trump Explores Diplomacy With Iran While Weighing Strikes, Officials Say
summary: The Pentagon is presenting a wider range of strike options to the president than previously reported. Targets could include Iran’s nuclear program and ballistic missile sites.

title: Why China Is Suddenly Obsessed With American Poverty
summary: State media, embracing the gaming phrase “kill line,” is asserting China’s political superiority over the United States, deflecting focus on China’s own economic challenges.

title: Meta Plans to Cut 10% to 15% of Employees in Reality Labs Business
summary: The layoffs are set to be announced this week and would affect Meta’s work on the metaverse, as the company spends heavily on building artificial intelligence.

title: Apple Teams Up With Google for A.I. in Its Products
summary: Apple was facing increasing questions about its plans for artificial intelligence as other big tech companies invested tens of billions in the technology.

title: Arson Suspect Targeted Mississippi Synagogue for Its ‘Jewish Ties,’ F.B.I. Says
summary: The suspect, Stephen Spencer Pittman, was turned in by his father, who said his son had laughed as he confessed to the fire that damaged the synagogue, investigators said.

title: Synagogue Is Vandalized Days After Anniversary of L.A. Wildfire That Leveled It
summary: Graffiti denouncing Zionism was discovered Sunday on a wall of the campus, which has not yet been rebuilt after the Eaton fire.

title: Gavin Newsom Vows to Stop Proposed Billionaire Tax in California
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom said he was working behind the scenes to block a proposed tax on billionaires’ wealth and was committed to defeating the measure if it reached the ballot.

title: Why New Jersey Is Running Out of Groundhogs
summary: Since Milltown Mel died, a New Jersey town has faced a groundhog crisis. Now the governor has vetoed an effort to bring in out-of-state replacements.

title: Trump’s Attack on the Federal Reserve Is Already Backfiring
summary: And the market is gently shrugging.

title: The Resistance Libs Were Right
summary: Trump’s message, the emotional core of his movement, has always been textbook fascism.

title: Elle Simone Scott, Chef and Cooking Show Stalwart, Dies at 49
summary: She was the first Black cast member on the PBS show “America’s Test Kitchen,” and used her influence to help other female chefs of color.

title: Pitching Crypto and Needling Mamdani: Adams’s Post-Mayoralty Takes Shape
summary: Two weeks ago, Eric Adams was in Times Square to lead the New Year’s Eve ball drop as his last act as mayor. He returned on Monday to promote a new business interest.

title: Dan Bongino, No Longer at the F.B.I., Will Return to Podcasting
summary: The former F.B.I. deputy director, who had hosted a right-wing, pro-Trump podcast, will restart the show after a rocky tenure at the law-enforcement agency.

title: Former Congressional Employee Accused of Stealing 240 Phones
summary: A Maryland man used his government job to order new cellphones worth over $150,000 and then sell them to a pawnshop, federal prosecutors said.
